headline.main: F.D.A. Takes Action on Antidepressants and Migraine Drugs
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Issues Alert On Antidepressants And Migraine Drugs

docs.snippet: The agency asked that drug labels include information about an uncommon but life-threatening lung problem for babies whose mothers took the drugs during pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration asked Wednesday that manufacturers of Prozac and similar antidepressants change their labels to include information about an uncommon but life-threatening lung problem that can affect babies born to mothers who take the drugs during pregnancy. The agency also issued an alert about the possible risk of combining antidepressant medications with common migraine drugs called triptans, saying a life-threatening condition called serotonin syndrome might occur when the drugs are combined.

docs.lead_paragraph: Princess Kiko, who is due to give birth to her third child in September, has developed a complication that may require her to undergo a Caesarean section, palace officials said. Her pregnancy has been closely followed in Japan, whose imperial family has failed to produce a male heir to the throne since 1965. The palace doctor said both Kiko, 39, the wife of Emperor Akihito’s younger son, and the fetus, whose sex has not been disclosed, are in good health, but added that Kiko might have to be hospitalized if her condition gets worse. She was found to have symptoms of partial placenta previa, in which a portion of the cervix is covered by the placenta. The condition can cause heavy bleeding.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Medical Journal Says It Was Again Misled'' (news article, July 13):
docs.abstract: Dr Jeffrey B Freedman letter holds that it is clear that medications are indicated when pregnant woman is in agitated and psychotic state, but this is not always case for depression (July 13 article)
